author: volviq
body:
Steps to reproduce
------------------
```
# Mount a CD ISO or insert a CD to drive.
# Go to the drives folder:
cd G:
# Establish a remote session (In my case a running Nano Server vm):
$ip=[ip address]
Set-Item WSMan:\localhost\Client\TrustedHosts $ip
$s = New-PSSession -ComputerName $ip -Credential ~\Administrator
#Copy over the file to the remote system:
Copy-Item -ToSession $s -Path .\Filename.example c:\
```


Expected behavior
-----------------
No Error messages/Exceptions are shown in case there is no valid reason.

Actual behavior
---------------

In case the file is within a mounted ISO, I get the following error message:
```
Copy-Item : The parameter is incorrect
At line:1 char:1
+ Copy-Item -ToSession $s -Path .\Filename.example c:\
+ ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
    + CategoryInfo          : NotSpecified: (:) [Copy-Item], Win32Exception
    + FullyQualifiedErrorId : System.ComponentModel.Win32Exception,Microsoft.PowerShell.Commands.CopyItemCommand
```

The file is still successfully copied to the remote system.

Doing the same from a normal hard drive does not show the exception.


Environment data
----------------

<!-- provide the output of $PSVersionTable -->

Reproducible on Official installed Release:
```
Name                           Value                                                                                                                                                                     
----                           -----                                                                                                                                                                     
PSVersion                      5.1.14393.953                                                                                                                                                             
PSEdition                      Desktop                                                                                                                                                                   
PSCompatibleVersions           {1.0, 2.0, 3.0, 4.0...}                                                                                                                                                   
BuildVersion                   10.0.14393.953                                                                                                                                                            
CLRVersion                     4.0.30319.42000                                                                                                                                                           
WSManStackVersion              3.0                                                                                                                                                                       
PSRemotingProtocolVersion      2.3                                                                                                                                                                       
SerializationVersion           1.1.0.1   
```

And latest Github Release:
```
Name                           Value
----                           -----
PSVersion                      6.0.0-alpha
CLRVersion

PSEdition                      Core
PSCompatibleVersions           {1.0, 2.0, 3.0, 4.0...}
SerializationVersion           1.1.0.1
WSManStackVersion              3.0

```

### EDIT1:
exception come from inside `GetStreams`
![copyitem_1](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/47276302/166445757-1a3a26c0-38c0-40ad-9a2d-18f58bb10568.png)

Exception is trigger by `FindFirstStreamW` native api : 
*Enumerates the first stream with a ::$DATA stream type in the specified file or directory.*
`Path = @"\\vmware-host\Shared Folders\ShareVm\psscript\INSTALL2\Certs\hello.txt"`

![copyitem_2](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/47276302/166446101-0cc98a7b-c192-4917-9e9d-bab9f5490d2a.png)

### EDIT2

This error also appears with : 
```ps
PS > Get-Item "\\vmware.....\hello.txt" -Stream *
```
a possible explanation :  [https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/issues/10570#issuecomment-694454277](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/issues/10570#issuecomment-694454277)

temporary fix : manage Win32Exception with try/catch
